AdditionalFields.Value: Bioinformatics / Computational Biology / Systems Biology / Convergent Science,Population Sciences

Description: The Human Tumor Atlas Network (HTAN) is a National Cancer Institute (NCI) Cancer Moonshot initiative to generate three-dimensional molecular and spatial atlases of diverse human tumors and to characterize transitions in cancer progression. HTAN is working closely with NCI Cancer Research Data Commons to ensure long term-legacy and reuse of HTAN data and to share data using NCI's Cloud Resources. In this session, speakers describe how to access, query, download, process, and visualize HTAN data derived from a variety of assay types, including single cell RNA sequencing and multiplexed spatial proteomics, using the HTAN Data Portal and NCI Cloud Resources.
PrimaryCategory: Bioinformatics / Computational Biology / Systems Biology / Convergent Science
SearchResultBody: MW006. HTAN Data in the Wild: Accessing and Analyzing Single-Cell Sequencing and Highly Multiplexed Spatial-proteomics using the HTAN Data Portal and NCI’s Cloud Resources
Title: HTAN Data in the Wild: Accessing and Analyzing Single-Cell Sequencing and Highly Multiplexed Spatial-proteomics using the HTAN Data Portal and NCI’s Cloud Resources
